website_summaries.verdict: Designed specifically for hauling dogs, this option is well constructed and capable of hauling bigger pups.
pros: Features a sunroof so your furry friend can enjoy the weather while riding in style
Sturdy ride even when carrying a big dog — up to 110 pounds
Wheels come off easily for storing purposes
Useful side pockets built onto the cab
cons: Could use some more storage space and it'll take some getting used to for the dog

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever!
customer_reviews.text: I don't want to over-exercise my large breed, 75-lb. puppy, but I don't want to leave him home either. This way I have the best of both worlds ~ I can trot him easily alongside and when he tires, he can climb in the back. Or if I want to get out on a ride, he can come with me. One thing we did (as someone else suggested) was to put grommets in each corner of the mat and tie them to the sides so the mat doesn't slide around. Hopefully the video shows up which will demonstrate how easily my dog took to the cart.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle Gibson

customer_reviews.title: The first time my 65lb dog rode in this trailer ...
customer_reviews.text: The first time my 65lb dog rode in this trailer a very short distance, appropriately harnessed by the safety leash, he stepped in the bag corner of the trailer and the seems split instantly! The product info says safe for up to 110lb!! I don't think so...
customer_reviews.author: Casey Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Not very comfortable for a dog to ride at a slant
customer_reviews.text: I would give this 5 stars, however i have a bike with 700cc wheels. When i hook this to it, it tilts up. Not very comfortable for a dog to ride at a slant. I emailed Solvit, they said it was engineered for bikes with 26in wheels. It would be nice if this was in the description- now i have a very expensive grocery carrier. Also, I have a 30lb dog, and would say a large would have been a better fit. Update: Solvit said putting the 20in wheels (from the larger size) would fix my issue and are sending them at no cost to me. They earned my 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Kbear

customer_reviews.title: :) YES!
customer_reviews.text: So excited to having finally purchased the houndabout ii! After researching dog trailers a few months back, I was instantly sold on this. Wasn’t a priority at the time because the winter months were setting it. Now, it’s spring and we are proud owners of this trailer. It took our pup a few miles to get comfortable but after making the trek to the river and letting him run and swim, it seemed like he enjoyed the ride back a little better (or he was too pooped to care). Either way, this trailer has gave the opportunity to bring our pup along for the ride!
customer_reviews.author: Curt

customer_reviews.title: Nothing was missing and very easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Got the product today, earlier than expected. Nothing was missing and very easy to put together. My husband cut the ply wood 28.5"x 22" and rounded the edges. We put the wood on top of the lower bars at the bottom for a better support. My dog weight 94lbs. He barked the whole time we drove. We have to try this few times so get used to it. It is pretty sturdy. Looking forward to the rides once he stops barking.'
customer_reviews.author: Linda Vo

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a large aluminum. Easy to install. Heavy duty and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really love this..my 90# 10 yo dobie mix rides very comfortably in this. Tows great behind my bike.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine N.

customer_reviews.title: Great for sunny days out with the pup
customer_reviews.text: My 100lbs pitbull loves this thing! Great for sunny days out with the pup. Not waterproof. Although it has a clear shield for the rain in the front, far too many places for rain to get into the cargo area for even a light shower without my pup getting wet. Also slightly bulky and will barely fit through doorway without having to be collapsed down (not an easy process that requires screwing in a support beam across the top). You will need a garage or shed to keep it in. Still other than that, it is sturdy and I feel safe having my Bubba back there..
customer_reviews.author: Atom Bowen

customer_reviews.title: The wheels are still steel on the aluminum version
customer_reviews.text: A little disappointing. The aluminum model still uses heavy steel wheels. They could have made that more clear. Even the heavier, and 1/2 the price Shwinn competitor uses aluminum rims. Kind of disappointing. UPDATE: The tires are crap. They last about a month. They seem to be made for strollers not bike trailers. You can literally see how much tread has worn off after a short ride. I've tried several 16" tires and the only ones that last are the continental touring ones.
customer_reviews.author: Bill M.

customer_reviews.title: Bad Design for Larger Dogs
customer_reviews.text: This unit cannot accommodate our 85lb shepherd. The wheels are too far back so all of his weight is on the front of the trailer which transfers to the bar connecting to the bike. The overload on this bar is causing the bar, spring, and axel of my bike to be strained. It is very hard to pedal because of this and I'm afraid that it is going to damage my bike over time. I will contact the manufacturer about a return.
customer_reviews.author: HappyGuy

customer_reviews.title: GREAT & POOR
customer_reviews.text: Least = 1- Tires are not as in pic, what comes are cheapo “Kmart” two dollar tires... 2- No screen over the top!!! So when the top is open MY DOGS can and do try and stand with legs hanging over the sides and front or even try to jump out while riding!!! 3- Pad dogs lay on is paper thin so u must add your own pillows or another dog pad... POSITIVES = 1- EVERYTHING ELSE ABOUT THIS IS PERFECT! It easily holds 2 dogs, one 55lbs and one 30lbs!! With beach gear, water and food all while riding miles to the beach. Super sturdy and the best we’ve ever had and we’ve gone through 4 human versions.
customer_reviews.author: Lunchbox88

customer_reviews.title: HORROR SHOW
customer_reviews.text: I am mortified I did not get around to updating this sooner. It capsized and my dog (still tethered) spilled out and got road rash. It does not take turns well. The center of gravity is too high. The stance of the wheels was not wide enough to be stable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice ride
customer_reviews.text: This took a bit my dog to get used to. The bottom base is cloth and cardboard, a bit to flexible for my 60 pound golden doodle. We cut a 1/4 inch pressboard to fit the bottom as some had recommended and he was more open to getting in. The trailer folds nice and flat even when the pressboard is left in. We did cover the pressboard with a spare carpet we had laying around. It takes a bit of coaxing at first, and short rides, but it wasn't to long before he would just hop right in. I love being able to take our dog on long and short rides.
customer_reviews.author: jbcarideo

customer_reviews.title: Annoying to try and make the bottom more sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Honestly i dont know what to say. Im sooo disapointed especially because this is soo expensive. My dog hates it and refuses to get in it after one successful trial run. Its sitting in my closet reminding me what a waste this was. I was hoping to be able to take my dog out more often on bike rides with me but i guess not. Its great if your dog will actually go in it and you can actually get in on your bicycle. Unfortunately for me, the bolt wouldnt come off my bike and j had to attach it in a weird way but oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Doodlebug

customer_reviews.title: Amazing doggie “carriage”
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for my 60 lb golden doodle. He likes to be able to rest in it after he runs next to our bike for a few miles. He was really reluctant at first and didn’t want to get inside, but now he jumps in and lays down to nap during our few hours bike rides. We used it extensively until we wore out the tires. Now I have to find new tires for it, hopefully that will not be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: I wish this trailer fit my bike
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, this trailer can only attach to the left side of the bike. My bike's architecture won't accommodate the attachment. It seems odd that there is no way to attach to the right side of a bike. I wish there were an alternative to returning this trailer.
customer_reviews.author: A Satisfied Reader

customer_reviews.title: Poor bottom support for a large dog.
customer_reviews.text: I do love this thing, but my dog weighs 60lbs and she looks like she is sitting in a hammock. The bottom has poor support and I didn’t trust it. Easy fix though. I cut 3 boards long enough to go across and sit on top of the frame bars on the inside. Then placed a thin board on top of that. Covered that with a mat big enough to go up the sides a bit so her feet can’t get stuck, and the cushion on top of the mat. It still folds down with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Capobianco

customer_reviews.title: Nicely Done
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for may 8 pound Morkie Plenty of extra room for water dish etc... Light aluminum frame accurately machined, easily assembled. Pulls extremely smooth, hardly noticeable. Width is about the same as the handlebars, follows without over-riding your space. Clear plastic front door prevents wheel dirt, water/mud from entering and can be opened as needed for ventilation. Only issue I had was to fabricate a adapter to use the axle bracket since the length of my bikes axle was not quite long enough.
customer_reviews.author: DRKO

customer_reviews.title: Not good for dogs over 90 pounds.
customer_reviews.text: The trailer is actually pretty good, but the connector for the bike is awful. My 100lb Rotty fit in the trailer ok, but his weight kept causing the trailer hitch to bend downward. As a result the trailer was actually able to rub against the rear wheel of my bike. Also there is a hole in the front of the trailer where a wheel for a running attachment can be added. The first time my dog got into the trailer, his foot went through he hole and got stuck. If you have a dog under 90 pounds this might be a decent trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Allen

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: I was using this so much when I lived somewhere where biking was possible. I would use it to take the dog to the park. At first my 60 pound Dobbie mix was scared stiff in it but gradually, with some treats being offered while he was in it, he started to relax. He seems to actually enjoy it now. I honestly feel safer biking around in it on the road because you are so much bigger than alone on a bicycle. Also drivers seem to be more courteous because the dog in the back is just too darn cute.
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie Halford

customer_reviews.title: Rolls but has issues
customer_reviews.text: I good idea but needs more attention to details in manufacturing. Holes for parking brake install were drilled through frame crooked, making it impossible to install the parking brake in the right position to actually make contact with the tire. Even though wheels are snapped into axle, the have play in them. Yes, main unit folds, but it requires unscrewing (disassembly) of top cross bar. Trailer arrived with bike attachment hitch missing. Also purchased front wheel/handle to convert to stroller, but it was warped (bent) causing wheel to roll at an angle and pull to one side. I will be returning and looking for something better quality.
customer_reviews.author: rebecca

customer_reviews.title: My pup’s favorite toy!
customer_reviews.text: After much research, I decided to get this Houndabout and I couldn’t be more pleased! Assembly was easy (single person) and it folds down to go in my Prius very easily! It is very sturdy and has real tires. My puppy weighs 50lbs and I scarcely feel it when she shifts around while we’re riding. I kept it inside for 2+ weeks so she could get used to it. She absolutely LOVES going for bike rides. Tip: I attached my GoPro to my bike seat and it’s been so fun watching her shenanigans while riding along back there!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: On our 3rd ride I was going around a curve at about 6 miles an hour and my 90 lb dog shifted - we fell and the top ripped and the side bars ripped off of the trailer. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: HoundAbout a Best Choice for our Westies
customer_reviews.text: After researching a variety of bicycle trailer/carts for our Westhighland Terriers to bike with us, I decided to try the Solvit HoundAbout. Ads said it was easy to assemble--true. YouTube videos showed it was easy to use and easy to pack up for storage or travel--true. The HoundAbout is solid and carries two Westies with no problem. It trails behind the bike evenly and takes rough spots well. I bought the aluminum version so it would not be bulky/heavy. This is a real winner! Uh...one recommendation, air up the tires before taking off...it makes a difference. :-)
customer_reviews.author: DLH

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for me
customer_reviews.text: I got the medium-size trailer for my 45 pound Shetland sheltie. He fits in well, seems to like it. I did read the comments about some of the trailer tipping over, so I got the medium-size as it is not tall enough for my dog to sit up. I don't plan to open the top . As long as his weight is lower, I don't seem to have any problems. Doesn't seem to have any tendency towards flipping over..
customer_reviews.author: VV

customer_reviews.title: Great product! I use it all summer with my ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I use it all summer with my 35 lb dog. It took her a few rides to get used to but hops right in now. Very sturdy design and material. Colapses and expands easily. Rubber mat included insided can be taken out to clean. Side pockets come in handy. Have had a hard time keeping tires inflated when not in use. Highly recommend this trailer for you and your pup! [...]
customer_reviews.author: Emily C.

customer_reviews.title: Other then that is great 👍
customer_reviews.text: There is only 1 entry from back side . Space inside isn't wide enough to make larger dogs turn around. If you keep in mind that your fury old Friend is suffering from arthritis that should make you wonder... My Kodi has no big deal come in but how to get out??! I have to pull him from his back - tail side .I wish this trailer could have the same entry opening from both sides. Other then that is great 👍
customer_reviews.author: Eva

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Zipper
customer_reviews.text: We used this less than 10 times and today while zipping the top flap closed the pull came off in my hand. Now there is no way to open the top flap unless I break the closed zipper open but it is ruined either way. This should not have happened - it is a cheap zipper.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Ferazzi

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! I got the large because it was only a $10 price difference for the medium and I have a lots of room in there with my little dog for a picnic basket or whatever you want! Customer Service, amazing I thought I was missing a piece she was going to send it to me got me all registered I found it easy to get a hold of
customer_reviews.author: caroleena55

customer_reviews.title: Good work out buddy!
customer_reviews.text: I started out by getting my 110lb AND my 55lb dog in it just inside and they both fit! While it was snug, they can both at least fit in it. However, once I tried to get them in it once it was attached to the bike, it was hard to keep still so my big dog didn’t want to get in. I’m kind of glad because pulling my smaller dog is DEFINITELY a work out! I don’t know how I’d tow 165lb behind me! But maybe one day! I can at least take my smaller dog with my on bike rides and it’s a good workout for me and fun for her!
customer_reviews.author: SpartyGirl

customer_reviews.title: Maybe for a short wide fat dog but not a fit tall dog at her ideal weight.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe for a short wide fat dog but not a fit tall dog at her ideal weight. It's a good carriage but an 87 lb. female German Shepherd Dog can be a bit crowded in it. I'm not sure that the weight and size ratings they have listed for the largest is accurate. I got this for my dog because she's a princess and she had had knee surgery. I wish I had been paid for this review or been given the carriage in exchange for a review but alas this is all me and I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: That guy that buys stuff

customer_reviews.title: Red medium fits both my 15lb Dachshunds very nicely.  They love it!
customer_reviews.text: Fits both my 15lb Dachshunds nicely. They stick their heads out and bark when we go riding on squirrel patrols. They absolutely love going with me on bike rides. The hitch fit my 2017 Raleigh Takoa without modification. They are providing the new style connector so order with confidence. Also, I love that Solvit has a good supply of parts for this entire trailer if something rips, breaks, or you get a flat tire - you can simply go online and order a replacement part.
customer_reviews.author: Kilroy

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Have a 25 lb welsh terrier and a 22 lb wire hair fox terrier and they both fit comfortably in this (I have the one with the 50lb limit). Easy to tear down to store and then reassemble. Really, it takes les than 5 minutes from when I pull the bike and folded HoundAbout out of the garage to get it attached and going. Less gettingit back in. Rolls smoothly but uphills you do notice you are pulling a couple of dogs. Hav3e an Electra Townie 3i (Nexus 3 speed) that I'm swapping the rear sprocket to lower the gearing a little.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Doro

customer_reviews.title: Large dog need more space
customer_reviews.text: I like the quality of the product. Our pup needs a firm bottom - like other owners we needed to add a board to the bottom. We have a 70# GSD and the large HoundAbout II is not long enough for him to lie down. He needs to curl up or sit up.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Given the weather wear I live a thunderstorm or showers show up out of no where pretty often. Sad to say it had to go ...
customer_reviews.text: Had to give it three stars because I never really got to use it. First off, the inside water resistant coating was very scratched up from transit or something small trying to claw its way out. Second thing. If you have Breeze style dropouts your out of luck as you cannot position the bike mounted hitch properly angled. I tried it anyways it was a no go. I took a picture of the inside scratches when I unboxed it. Given the weather wear I live a thunderstorm or showers show up out of no where pretty often. Sad to say it had to go back. One last thing, I never could get the rear reflectors mounted.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Munns

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: My 98# lab fits with the top open. Easy to fold, travel with, and pull. It does need a sturdier floor as others have mentioned. Fixable with a custom cut piece of wood. He's not crazy about it yet, but he's learning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Less $ than some others for a reason...
customer_reviews.text: 65lb greyhound was in it 3 times before it started to show wear and tear, so it's not robustly built at all. Tears in various spots I couldn't even figure where they came from and such. Great design and easy to break down, but it's of no value it starts falling apart that fast. I'd pay more $ for a better built/sturdier product.
customer_reviews.author: Will Brink

customer_reviews.title: Great product - let your dog join your plans!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. Easy to install (the black adapter for your bike axle can be left on for quick connection) and product feels very sturdy and durable. My dog is 70 lbs and it was still easy to pedal and maneuver. It took a little getting used for my dog but would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: DealHunter

customer_reviews.title: Everybody can go for a ride!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! We have a 45 lb. dog who adores this! The short leash inside is nice if you have the top/front open just to prevent any jumps out. It does not have a kickstand so be careful when loading and unloading. Definitely a workout if you’re not used to towing anything with the bike. Our dog was able to stand up and move around to get comfortable. We bought the stroller attachment to use with my parents aging golden retriever. He loves that he can still participate in walks! This was an excellent purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Big and stable
customer_reviews.text: Our boxer. at 70#s is a big boy. This carrier is suitable and comfortable for him as he has some back pain and is 10 years old. He loves his cart!
customer_reviews.author: texas two step

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our two 20lb babies-easy peasy assembly
customer_reviews.text: All around great product. Tires are a bit cheesy and will need an upgrade. Purchased for our two 20lb cairn terriers. We also bought a couple of 28” leash extenders to clip on the d-rings and their collars so we can cruise with the top rolled back (added a key ring and a carabiner for a few extra inches, which makes them the perfect length). Also, added heavy duty Velcro to the cushion to keep it from slipping around, and this has worked well so far. Good product for one big dog, or two medium dogs. Feasible if you have three small ones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recommended! Good quality and easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: Perfect trailer for two small fur babies (6 and 9 lbs). Putting this together was simple and did not take long. Only issue I have and really is small, is that there is no place to mount a flag. I improvised and mounted the flag in the rear on an exposed part of the frame with zip ties. Trailer is solid and riding with it takes hardly any effort, just watch your sharp turns. 😁 I’ll be adding a short video soon because I like this trailer a lot!
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: It works at least with my trike...
customer_reviews.text: Product description says it will not work with adult trikes, I asked a question and only got another question from customer support. I took a chance, it arrived today, set up easily and WORKS JUST FINE on my Catrike. Took my 55# standard poodle for his first ride and all went fine. He is a littler edgy about it, but I think with more experience he will be fine. I was impressed with the package it came in and while the bottom is soft, it doesn't look at all weak for him.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best dog trailer ever!!
customer_reviews.text: So easy to put together and great quality material. Recommend to get the aluminum trailer to save some weight. Our Sooner girl loves her chariot and being towed around everywhere. Everyone we pass sm8kes as they see her. It is a bit wide but just barely fits between the up poles on the trails. Recommrmdkng to everyone!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solvit HoudAbout Pet Trailer
customer_reviews.text: My dog and I love the Solvit HoundAbout Pet Trailer. Trailer was easy to assembly and seems to be holding up well. I like the netting in the rear and the option of rolling up the front like a "convertible" . There's a short leash to attach and secure your pup in the trailer. Pockets may it convenient for snacks and water. Removable pad isn't very thick but provides some padding.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Trailer. Don't leave your BFF behind!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome trailer! My 11 year old 85 pound girl is getting up there in age, and she recently had surgery on her leg, so she can't get around as well as she used to. But we love the outdoors and we used to walk and hike for hours.So I bought this trailer and I/we love it! I was nervous that it wouldn't be big enough or the padding wouldn't be thick enough, but everything was perfect! It wasn't hard to put together. I live in a small 2-bedroom apartment and it was also easy to fold down.And it pops right back up, ready to go on our next adventure.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Norvell

customer_reviews.title: Great! Dog loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, but it was missing one of the bolts that attaches the arm to the bottom of trailer, so a trip to the hardware store was needed. Otherwise, no issues. The aluminum trailer is light, and quickly and easily attaches to a bike. Collapses easily for transport. The dog loves it, and it's a way for him to get out of the house after his spine injury. We also have the front wheel for stroller conversion. Great product, and worthy of 5 stars, even with the missing bolt.
customer_reviews.author: Raoul Lufbery

customer_reviews.title: Glad i got it.
customer_reviews.text: Every bit as good as a Burley, i think, and for a lot less money. Pulled smoothly, light weight, well-constructed. Two wishes-- That the towing rod were easily removed so the cart could be used as a crate in the car, and the zippers were sturdier. This trailer weighs about half of the one i had previously at twice the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Dawnie Gee

customer_reviews.title: 80lb Labrador Retriever Loves
customer_reviews.text: We have a Lab who goes with us everywhere, she is our only child. This hooks up to your bike (get attachment) easily! Even my 80lb lab fits good in it and it is sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Fun in the sun with my labradoodle!!
customer_reviews.text: It assembles quickly and connects reasonably easily with the bicycle. The dog enjoys riding in it. You can pop the sunroof so the dog can get some air. A ride to the dog park and everybody wins. It’s fun!
customer_reviews.author: J. PARKER

customer_reviews.title: Older dog must have, in the heat.
customer_reviews.text: Great for our older pitbull who weighs 105lbs. Not entirely convenient to fold up in the car, so we only remove the wheels and keep it in the back of our Toyota Highlander.
customer_reviews.author: Nanny Goat

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Super disappointed. I researched for literally months to find something that would hold my 73# dog. Hooked it to our bike and it leans too far forward I couldn’t load or unload the dog without my bike falling over. It did have a nice durable liner on the bottom which was super nice. The windows were nice. How the wheels bowed in a little with my dog in it.
customer_reviews.author: army_mp

customer_reviews.title: Good trailer, have a large dog fits well
customer_reviews.text: Good trailer,have a large dog fits well. Bad thing is the dog sitting up makes it top heavy, flipped on it side on an asphalt trail. Was very fortunate my dog wasn't injured. Would use it for smaller dogs. Manufacturer should consider a wider wheel base with a lower center of gravity.
customer_reviews.author: KS...

customer_reviews.title: What an amazing purchase! I left some questions about whether or ...
customer_reviews.text: What an amazing purchase! I left some questions about whether or not it would work with a large 65 pound dog and smaller shih tzu but they both fit just fine in the trailer with room to spare. The assembly does take a bit of time and it's not the easiest to fit in your car without taking the wheels off but they enjoyed the ride through the trails!
customer_reviews.author: J. Pizarro

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit so I could tote my two spoiled twenty pound Schnauzers around the neighborhood. It attached easily to my Trek, and I put them in. They were pretty weirded out at first, but they got used to it. I definitely felt the extra 40 pounds I was hauling around. My legs burned like fire! The material is strong, the unit seems sturdy, and I believe it will last quite a while. This is a quality dog cart. I don't use it often, though. Maybe once every three months.
customer_reviews.author: jessica fricke

customer_reviews.title: Great pet trailer!
customer_reviews.text: Great trailer! However, the trailer hitch wasn't as easy to mount to the rear wheel. Depending on the size of the dog, the trailer can get very heavy. But it is easy to use, easy to store, and clean. The dog is totally happy to ride in it.
customer_reviews.author: Sue B

customer_reviews.title: Very roomy
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of room for my 50lb pit mix. Seems very sturdy and easy to fold down for transportation. The hitch has to be extremely tight to avoid spinning on the dropout, but no other complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put up and down
customer_reviews.text: This trailer is now named, The Rajeep. It went cross country in our small RV, so Raji could come on bike adventures with us. It is so light weight and easy to fold. Highly recommend it. We got the large model, hubby can then stow his inflatable kayak AND Raji and ride down to the river. If you see us in Bend, Oregon on our RAD Power Bikes, say hi.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Staack Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Our dogs are 15pounds each. Tires worn out in 60miles
customer_reviews.text: These are the tires after 60 miles. We are extremely disappointed in the quality. I would expect a new set of tires or a full refund. Very poor quality. We would not recommend this unless you’re only using for 60 miles.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Sublime Doggie Trailer
customer_reviews.text: Amazing omg is it awesome for our pets. Ok for 2 small size or just one medium. Very sturdy and comfortable too.
customer_reviews.author: Deepblue

customer_reviews.title: Great pet carrier
customer_reviews.text: A great pet carrier. Don't be discouraged if you dog takes a while to get used to it. Our dig finds it fun after being a but apprehensive...
customer_reviews.author: Bykhyk

customer_reviews.title: Everything and more
customer_reviews.text: This is fantastic, my 65lb pitmix has plenty of room in the large. Also rides very smooth!! Lots of attention and compliments.
customer_reviews.author: timmy

customer_reviews.title: Now our dogs can enjoy bike rides with us!
customer_reviews.text: Our pups LOVE riding in this trailer! It was easy to assemble, and it folds down for easy storage or transport to our favorite bike trail. We purchased two extra safety leads so that all our dogs can ride safely. The trailer is a little heavy, but it's also solidly built.
customer_reviews.author: Tom N. Tumbusch

customer_reviews.title: Made our dog’s life better!
customer_reviews.text: I would give 5 stars if it weren’t for assembling the front wheel got the stroller attachment (sold separately). Very tricky! That being said, this stroller has greatly improved our senior dog’s life! Now he can be out and about in the neighborhood Just like old times! Very sturdy and a tight, smooth ride! We are impressed! Should have bought it sooner! Worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Storage problems
customer_reviews.text: I believe many others have written about the lack of padding or shock absorbers. The trailer has all those but functions pretty well. It has three pockets that are almost worthless. They don't close well so anything in them may fall out. They are also the wrong size for anything that the dog may use. We can't even put a water bottle in one. A place to put a safety flag would be very welcome. I would have given this 4 stars but the worthless pockets downgraded it to 3.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and we were on the road within minutes! Mini aussie loves it! She's too small (30 lbs.) to run along side of the bikes and too big to put in a basket so a great way to take her with us on our rides. Jumped right in! Super sturdy, she feels safe and as long as you take it easy on turns works great!! Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Missing safety tether
customer_reviews.text: Safety tether was missing from this. If company send me a replacement I will update to 5 stars. Otherwise I will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: K. Reich

customer_reviews.title: Great for a big dog, but NO SHARP TURNS!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and well made product. However, watch your turns. Made a quick turn from a sidewalk to cross the street and tipped the trailer over. The dog was fine, but I'll be much more careful in future.
customer_reviews.author: smh

customer_reviews.title: Soooo much fun
customer_reviews.text: This is a great solution for animals that are old, lame, or just lazy and owners who are not. We purchased this because our Siberian Husky has bad knees, she can walk, just not for long. We wanted to return to biking and didn't want to leave her home. This is the unit that Solv'dIt...... It follows the bike great, she fits and is comfortable. Actually she likes to ride with her head out the top saying hi to everyone as we ride by. It is easy to get the animal in and out. Just alot of fun and a great way to have a family outing.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Drescher

customer_reviews.title: great quality but to small for my dog who is ...
customer_reviews.text: great quality but to small for my dog who is a 35lb cheagle. if your wondering about size go next larger wort case your dog has more room. Great design and good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't change a thing.  Love it.
customer_reviews.text: We have the aluminum version and the smaller of the two sizes. Perfect fit for our 25 lb. mini-doodle. I admire products like this one as it's well thought out and engineered. Construction seems to be well executed with quality materials. Can't say anything negative. This is our second pet trailer.
customer_reviews.author: W. J. Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of room for 20 lb Jack Russell. Can hardly tell that there is a trailer attached. Seems very solid. There was a small tear in the safety webbing that is attached to the metal arm. This webbing is just a backup in case the arm was to break free from the bicycle. I really don't think it is that crucial. We were able to still attach it, no problem, just probably not as strong as it would have been had it not been torn. Amazon was very accomidating in helping us get this right!!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra S.

customer_reviews.title: The engineering that went in to the design of this ...
customer_reviews.text: The engineering that went in to the design of this trailer is impressive. The quality of materials and workmanship is exceptional. The ease of assembly and compactness when collapsed even with the wheels stored inside is remarkable. The use of aluminum in the superstructure was an essential criteria as we will be using this along with our aluminum bikes while cruising in salt water on our sailboat. Having seen and used this product, the price of this trailer is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Clough

customer_reviews.title: A great ride for our pup!
customer_reviews.text: We like the flexibility to open the top partway or the whole way so the dog can poke her head out! It’s a sturdy, easy to tow little cart!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Lehner

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: 🥰 love it I cut a board to place in the bottom to support and keep dogs from tearing canvas or falling throug. It now holds 2 Golden retrievers at 65 and 72 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: sandy beach

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoy this trailer. I had a slight problem with one of the tires, but the customer service was friendly and prompt with a new replacement part shipped asap at no cost to me. My dog LOVES going on rides in this thing!
customer_reviews.author: David Dickson

customer_reviews.title: Great find.
customer_reviews.text: Super super happy with this cart. Easy to pull behind my bike. Big enough for two small dogs but not too big to be cumbersome. Lightweight but durable.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Leon

customer_reviews.title: 80lb pit bull loves his carrier!
customer_reviews.text: Our dog loves his carrier. Great way to bring him on adventures now that his is getting older and long walks are more difficult. We ended up getting a wood board to put under for more stability and put a yoga mat on top for grip.
customer_reviews.author: Warren

customer_reviews.title: it looks like it was used previously
customer_reviews.text: just opened it just to found out its missing a bike hitch. it looks like it was used previously!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Just got it this week and took it for a test run with the hound. So far so good. Works well. Dog likes it. Only complaint is the included leash to keep the dog from jumping out is about 6" short (at max adjusted length) for optimal comfort of 80 lbs. dog. Will update if I run into any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew S

customer_reviews.title: This is a very nice pet trailer
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice pet trailer. I do wish the floor was a bit more rigid or had another strap. I've used it a lot with my 24 lb. dog and he loves it. I don't find it that much more effort to pull it and the dog behind me. I see it as an added workout. As for the assembly, it gets easier each time you put it together and break it down. It's a good price for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi C.

customer_reviews.title: Super fast setup
customer_reviews.text: Amazon product! Super fast setup. I did have to drill a little bit on the axle attachment point just because I'm on a Giant Anthem mountain bike that has a thru-axle. Only suggestion/qualm with this product is that the cushion is very slick to where it bunches up and doesn't allow my 90 pound German Shepherd to get much padding. I'm thinking about either putting something in there with more loft and what doesn't slide or maybe putting some velcro underneath the padding to keep it in place. Great fun and lots of looks!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua R Pendley

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, happy pup and me
customer_reviews.text: Arrived today, had a great ride with my pup. Love all the options with zippers/pockets/mesh. Smooth ride, too. Looking forward to many more rides!
customer_reviews.author: Dan's books and things

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! Everyone can bike ride together
customer_reviews.text: Great product, for bigger dogs I would suggest adding some sort of support underneath. My husband will install plexiglass to make it feel more secure for our pup
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great Quality. My dog is 12 years old and 105 lbs and he loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa L

customer_reviews.title: Instruction is horrible
customer_reviews.text: The instruction is horrible. Prepare to put the whole stuff together without it. Even the pictures they had were confusing. We were also missing a bolt and will have to get one at Home Depot or Menard later. We haven’t test ride it yet and will update after we do.
customer_reviews.author: Thien

customer_reviews.title: Depends on your dog.
customer_reviews.text: This went together fine, we were really looking forward to it and our dog was never more confused. We have a lab, we kept in the living room for a while so he would get used to it, gave him some treats in it. Then we took him around the block. He would not sit down and relax and just wanted out.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: My dog ate it
customer_reviews.text: My dog stressed and destroyed it before I got around the block. It is ruined. $230 bucks in the trash. It was a great idea....but...
customer_reviews.author: Beno

customer_reviews.title: Great item.  Easy to pull with 50 pound dog inside
customer_reviews.text: Very good for carrying my dog around. Easy to setup, easy to fold.
customer_reviews.author: carl r compton

customer_reviews.title: sturdy, great customer service
customer_reviews.text: bought this to haul under ourrv, folds flat and small, wheels come off with the push of a button, i have a 40 lb dog got the large alum cart. seems stable pulls relatively easily. the cast piece that attaches to the bike was bent called the seller no issues with getting a new one out to me free with expedited shipping would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you need to tow a dog with a bike, this is the item to buy 😁👍
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the dog trailer, I bought the large one for dogs up to 110 lb. I've used it on my 80 lb dog, and on another occasion I used it for 3 dogs at the same time, it works great. I love that the size of the trailer it's not much bigger then the kids trailer but specifically designed for dogs so there's more room.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Sanders

customer_reviews.title: So far so good to great!
customer_reviews.text: We've not had this long enough to give it a full assessment but, initial reactions and results are all positive. The unit is well constructed and lightweight. It's quite handsome and made even more handsome by our beloved canine Carter.
customer_reviews.author: kimkindle

customer_reviews.title: Great product. I have a 65 pound pit bull ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I have a 65 pound pit bull terrier that can run about a mile and then she is done. She looks forward to riding in the stroller. She will ride for a while then run a little then back to riding. We both get our exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Sanfelippo

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and quantity
customer_reviews.text: I am so pleased with my Petsafe dog trailer. My basset hound loves riding in it with his head out the front door. I had a slight problem with one of the tires and Petsafe went far and beyond to resolve the problem. I would highly recommend this trailer and the customer service at Petsafe. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Linda D.

customer_reviews.title: We tote our Newfoundland around in this and it works ...
customer_reviews.text: We tote our Newfoundland around in this and it works well. Our Newfie is about 100 pounds right now and we have to have the top open so she fits, but it works. Not sure if it will still work for us when she weighs about 130, but I'm hopeful. I wish they made a trailer that was just a little larger than this, but AFAIK, this is the biggest one unless you spend a lot more money. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: A. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: This dog trailer is amazing, works very well, it’s easy to assemble, very sturdiness and my dog loved. The best choice ;)
customer_reviews.author: Aline Serigioli

customer_reviews.title: Well made and thought out,
customer_reviews.text: Seems well made and thought out. Only shortcoming I found is it says rated up to 110 pounds. I've got a dog well under that but is actually a bit too long in the body to get comfortable in it. The whole reason I got it is he's getting old and stiff in the hips. He's not comfortable sitting and it's a bit cramped lying down.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, my pup couldn't be happier. She loves going for rides. Stiching could be better, but is holding up with many rides.
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with all bikes.
customer_reviews.text: The hitch does not work with my quick release bike tire system. This is such a disappointment because it never explained that under the description. I can only use it as a stroller.
customer_reviews.author: smr

customer_reviews.title: Great pet trailer
customer_reviews.text: Our mini-poodle loves to let his ears flap in the wind with the top open. The cat (with all the zippers closed) seems to like going for a ride, too. Sturdy and hooks up easily and securely to bikes, yet packs down quickly for travel in the car. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Psorcon

product_meta.title: Solvit HoundAbout II Pet Bicycle Trailer, Aluminum Frame
product_meta.description: Size:Large, Aluminum FrameGet ready for riding trails and wagging tails with the PetSafe Happy Ride Aluminum Dog Bicycle Trailer. The lightweight, durable construction of the frame lets you easily go for bike rides with your best friend behind you. Clip the safety tether to your furry friend’s harness to keep them safe and secure inside the bike trailer. Your dog will enjoy the ride with a view looking out the ventilated side, front and rear windows. Pack your best buddy’s leash, water and treats for the adventure and store them in the 3 storage pouches on the outside of the bike trailer. At the end of a fun-filled day, the bike hitch quickly disconnects from your bicycle and you can collapse the sides of the trailer for easy storage. PetSafe brand is here to help you and your pet LIVE HAPPY TOGETHER.
feature_bullets: LIGHTWEIGHT ALUMINUM: A light, durable aluminum constructed frame lets you easily go for bike rides with your best friend in tow
A RIDE WITH A VIEW: Let your pet enjoy the view while looking out the back, front and side ventilated windows while give them shade from the sun
SAFE AND SECURE: A safety tether inside the trailer attaches to your furry friend’s harness to keep them safe when hitting the trails; weather-resistant trailer has reflectors for added visibility
EASY TO CONNECT: The trailer hitch quickly connects to your bicycle; at the end of your adventure with your best friend, easily disconnect the hitch and collapse the trailer for storage
STORAGE POUCHES: 3 pockets on the outside of the trailer allow you to bring your pup’s leash, treats, water and poop bags along on your adventure
SIZING: Medium trailer holds dogs up to 50 lb and the inside cab measures 26 in L x 17 in W x 20 in H; Large trailer holds dogs up to 110 lb and the inside cab measures 33 in L x 22 in W x 26 in H
IMPORTANT INFORMATION: The bike trailer does not work with any tricycle bikes; trailer is compatible with bikes that have a Shimano gear set
U.S.-BASED CUSTOMER CARE: Let our pet product experts help; we’re available Monday through Saturday to answer your questions at 1-800-845-3274
